intro: Zehneria backeri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including pink, purple, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Zehneria backeri is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
